newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: A Soriano officers deny rift in board.
newsitem.headline: A Soriano officers deny rift in board.

text.p: Officials of holding firm A. Soriano Corp (Anscor) on Wednesday denied there was a rift in the board of directors and attributed newspaper reports on trouble within the company to disagreements "between brothers".
"It's (disagreements) were between brothers," A Soriano vice chairman Carlos Soriano told reporters when asked to comment on the reports of a rift with his elder brother Andres Soriano III.

Newspaper reports of disagreements between the Soriano brothers on the management of the company their grandfather founded in 1930 had sparked speculation there would be a battle for control of the board at the firm's stockholders meeting on Wednesday.
"The 11-member board of Anscor met before the stockholders meeting to thresh out the problems," an official of the company who did not want to be named told Reuters.
The elder brother Andres Soriano, who is chairman of Anscor, said: "There are problems but we figured out things which we don't need to publicise."
Andres Soriano is also chairman of San Miguel Corp, one of the largest companies in the Philippines.
Company officials declined to say what stake the Sorianos held in Anscor.
Anscor has interests in banking, transportation, real estate, mining, power generation, resort, cargo handling, manufacturing and agribusiness.
